description: From Latin chiasmus, from Ancient Greek χιασμός (khiasmós), from χιάζω (khiázō, “to mark with a chi”), from χ (kh, “chi”).

nouns.description: chiasmus (countable and uncountable, plural chiasmi or chiasmuses)

entries.meaning: (rhetoric) An inversion of the relationship between the elements of phrases.
examples: The book of Habakkuk has been discovered to consist of a closely knit chiastic structure throughout. This is the first poem of such length to stand revealed as a literary unit of this kind, though chiasmus has already been discovered throughout many psalms […]
